title: Australian Government Makes Huge Investment In US Tim Tam Owner | 10 News+
description: Tim Tams are a beloved Aussie staple, but they aren’t Australian-owned.   Despite this, our government is tipping in $45 million Australian dollars to prop up the Arnott’s group, to help it refinance $1.75 billion in debt. It’s an investment that small Aussie businesses would love to benefit from but haven’t. title: Teenager’s High Court Challenge Of Under-16s Social Media Ban | 10 News+
description: It is now just over one week since the social media ban for under-16s came into effect. But the ban faces two High Court challenges, both claiming the regulation is unconstitutional.   One case is being led by two Sydney teenagers, backed by the Digital Freedom Project.   10 News+ speaks to one of the teen applicants, Noah Jones. title: Bondi Shooting Tribute, Australia’s Gun Buyback Scheme, Epstein Photos Released | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Questions are being raised over the actions of NSW Police after they were forced to release seven men arrested during a dramatic takedown in Western Sydney, a billion-dollar national gun buyback scheme will be established in the wake of the Bondi massacre, Queensland has been rocked by a brazen act of hate against the Muslim community, Sydney is starting to heal almost a week on from the Bondi terror attack, reclaiming the beach in a stunning show of solidarity, and Democrats in the US have released another batch of photographs as the deadline looms for the Epstein files to drop. title: Hephner The Alpaca Wins Volunteer Of The Year Award | 10 News+
description: The unlikely winner of the Calvary Bruce Hospital’s Volunteer of the Year award has been announced.   Hephner the Alpaca has travelled to almost every state and territory, raising about $30,000 for mental health charities and local families in need - making a difference through shear ‘wool’ power.

title: Epstein Files Released As Pressure Mounts For Full Disclosure | 10 News
description: The US Justice Department has released hundreds of thousands of pages from its investigations into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, following a new transparency law passed by Congress.  The first batch of documents was made public on Friday, with officials saying more records are still under review and will be released in the coming weeks.  Many of the files were heavily redacted to protect victims and ongoing investigations, and it remains unclear how much new information they contain.  The documents include multiple references and photos of former US president Bill Clinton, while making scant mention of President Donald Trump.  Lawmakers have criticised delays in the rollout, saying the law requires all unclassified Epstein-related material to be made public. title: Bondi Tribute As Lifesavers Hold Minute Silence, Minns Pushes Hate Speech Crackdown | 10 News
description: As Australia prepares to mark one week from the massacre that claimed 15 lives, today another emotional tribute. title: Woman Charged After Alleged Carjacking And Dramatic Sydney Police Takedown | 10 News
description: A woman is tonight behind bars accused of a terrifying carjacking that saw another woman try to flee from a moving van and the vehicle chased through western Sydney streets before it was rammed by officers in a dramatic takedown.   The accused is now facing a string of charges with police alleging the delivery van was one of two vehicles she'd stolen. title: Weight-Loss Drug Wegovy Closer To PBS Subsidy Under New Recommendation | 10 News
description: Medical professionals and users of a weight-loss wonder drug have welcomed a recommendation to make it more available at a cheaper price. title: Biosecurity Dogs On Alert As Christmas Deliveries Spike | 10 News
description: More than 100 million parcels are expected to be delivered to homes across the country in the lead up to Christmas, but beyond the posties, there's also a crack team of canines protecting our borders.  Australia's biosecurity detector dog squad is growing, with six new members joining the team.   10 News was given exclusive access inside a Sydney mail centre to watch the new recruits at work.
